intro: Oxydectes incerta, commonly known as the uncertain oxydectes, is a rare and enigmatic plant species belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its delicate, daisy-like flowers with yellow central discs and white to pale blue ray florets. Native to specific regions in South America, it thrives in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, aiding in moisture retention. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Oxydectes incerta is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and climate change.
